motrpacWAT 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Create Annotated UpSet Plot

    plot_upset.Rd

    Create an UpSet plot annotated with intersection and set sizes. Essentially a modified version of UpSet.

    plot_upset(
  x,
  top_n_comb = 10,
  comb_title = "Intersection\nSize",
  set_title = "Set Size",
  scale = 2,
  barplot_args = list(),
  filename = character(0),
  height = 2 * scale,
  width = 3.4 * scale,
  units = "in",
  save_args = list(),
  upset_args = list()
)

    Arguments

    x

    list; named list of elements in each set. Passed to make_comb_mat.

    top_n_comb

    numeric; number of largest intersections to show. Default is 10.

    comb_title

    character; title of top barplot annotation. Default is "Intersection Size".

    set_title

    character; title of right barplot annotation. Default is "Set Size".

    scale

    numeric; scaling factor for all plot elements. Improves appearance. Default is 2.

    barplot_args

    list; additional arguments passed to anno_barplot.

    filename

    character; the filename used to save the UpSet plot. If provided, the plot will not be displayed.

    height

    numeric; the save height.

    width

    numeric; the save width.

    units

    character; the units of height and width. Default is "in" (inches).

    save_args

    list; additional arguments passed to the graphics device. See png for options.

    upset_args

    list; additional arguments passed to UpSet.

    Details

    See UpSet for details and sections mentioned in Arguments.

    References

    Lex, A., Gehlenborg, N., Strobelt, H., Vuillemot, R., & Pfister, H. (2014). UpSet: Visualization of Intersecting Sets. IEEE transactions on visualization and computer graphics, 20(12), 1983--1992. https://doi.org/10.1109/TVCG.2014.2346248
